intro: Aciphylla gracilis, commonly known as the slender cushion plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its low-growing, dense rosette of silver-gray leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, typically from December to February. Aciphylla gracilis is adapted to harsh alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. It is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, contributing to the unique flora of New Zealand's mountainous regions.
